column4: wow that was f*cked up,, my monitor just went crazy.. it was like zoom-in/zoom-out/zoom-in/zoom-out etc for about 2-3 seconds .. and it kinda made a click-sound
power off and reseat your video card
and your leads
well.. ill wait until its totally broken :)
how do you differ bins from bins then? :)
I take it you got the "file Filename" thing there a moment ago
yep :)
how do you know if its "sh", "run" or "./Filename" to use? :)
given the question I take it you already know the answer
hehe, actually not :)
man file will explain it better than I could in irc - it reads the file and looks for clues
thanks for the tip
type >>strings /bin/ls | less << then press CTRL+C
heh, what was that?
the fact when you type >>file /bin/ls<< a clue that was in that text allows file to tell you the result for the start of this line
ah, i see
inside most scripts you find >>#!/path/program to interpert the script<< so it can work out if it is a shell script perl or whatever
if a file has a +x value in the mode (ls -la)

so if the file has the executable bit set it will work with ./ otherwise perl foo.pl or sh file.sh - note the extentions are conventions and the shell does not have a convention to deal with them (but gnome / kde kind of do)
okay. thanks for explaining :)
there is so much to learn
little steps make for an easy journey, running fast you miss stuff
